title.narrative: Caritas Iraq: Humanitarian Aid in Erbil, Anbar and Baghdad

description.narrative: Internally Displaced and local People who are (severely) affected by the crisis in Northern Iraq

The goal of the project is to provide effective humanitarian aid to the most vulnerable crisis affected population, contributing significantly to decrease negative coping strategies. The specific objective is to provide effective humanitarian aid to the 800 most vulnerable crisis affected families in Erbil and Baghdad, to develop joined humanitarian program between Caritas Iraq and Cordaid, to strengthen the local capacity of Caritas Iraq. Sectors of intervention include:
* Multi-purpose Cash Assistance (cash provided by hand to hand due to security issues and people could not get cheque or vouchers) * Psychosocial support * Capacity Building

The project supports Internally Displaced and local People who are (severely) affected by the crisis in Northern Iraq. It aims to improve their food security, living conditions and well-being through the distribution of cash that can be used for shelter, food, household and medical or psycho-social services. Cordaid works closely together with Caritas Iraq and builds upon Caritas Iraq’s capacity.
